page.title: 03Health Care in Shepley.
page.content: Dr. Martin Dey took over the village practice from his father in 1968. His father had worked on his own from a large house on The Knowle for 33 years. He had about one thousand patients when he started in 1933. Dr. M. Dey continued to work from the house until 1975 when a new health clinic was built in the centre of the village. He now works here with two other doctors and has two thousand eight hundred patients himself and between them they have six thousand two hundred. People usually get their prescriptions made up at the Clinic. Twelve other people work at the Clinic. Once a year one of the Mobile Dental Units visits the Centre but in the last year a dentist has set up her own practice on a part time basis. She uses a converted cottage as a surgery and waiting room.
